alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 16 at 9:50PM EDT until September 17 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: The National Weather Service in Caribou has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Washington County in southeastern Maine... * Until 100 AM EDT. * At 950 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain in Charlotte causing areas of numerous flooding reported by the local fire department. Between 3.5 and 6.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Local fire department. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Calais, Perry, Pembroke, Princeton, Meddybemps, Fowler Township, Dyer Township, Baileyville, Robbinston, Alexander, Dennysville, Charlotte, Baring, Cooper, Northfield, Crawford, Wesley, Big Lake and Fowler. This includes the following streams and drainages... Cathance Stream, Sixteenth Stream, West Branch Millberry Brook, Dead Brook, Northern Stream, Taylor Brook, Dennys River, West Branch Enoch Brook, Creamer Brook, Anderson Brook, Allen Stream, Stony Brook, New Stream, Howe Brook, Venture Brook, Roaring Brook, Enoch Brook, Clifford Stream, Harrison Brook, East Machias River, Saint Croix River, Barnard Brook, Bear Brook, Fifteenth Stream, Meadow Brook, Hobart Stream, Eastern Stream, Rocky Meadow Brook, Seavey Stream, Curry Brook, Crow Brook, Little Huntley Brook, Magurrewock Stream, Patrick Brook, Pottle Brook, Mill Brook, Huntley Brook, Ohio Brook, Tomah Stream, Wilson Stream, Moosehorn Brook, Cobscook Bay, Lewys Brook, Maine River, Big Inlet, Northern Inlet, Splinter Brook, Millberry Brook, Cow Brook and Dog Brook. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
